messages.message: We should really do a PM on all these Python 3 upgrade issues… I know there were lots of fair warnings but we have kinda gotten ourselves stuck in this scenario where we upgraded non-dogfood instances to Python 3, made master not Python 2 compatible, and now have no way to do certain demos except on specialized instances of Instabase.
Like it might have been useful to test Python 3 dogfood for multiple months before pushing to any prod system
(this is not anyone’s fault though! And also this is not a blocker!!)

hey @Aaron Vontell -- happy to work through some of the challenges.

Is there a challenge with working off the release branch?

The plan was to no longer support Python 2 after that release branch, so if we wanted to make changes we would cherry-pick on the release branch.

And, the plan was to always have a Python 2 environment up and running, but I think deployments may have been mixed up by accident

Given those 2 conditions — always having a Python 2 environment running (dogfood.instabase.com (http://dogfood.instabase.com)) and having a release branch which supports Python 2 — is that sufficient to meet your needs?
Also i’ve tested basic fetcher in Python 3 during the UAT and it worked fine — are there cases where it doesn’t work in Python 3 currently?

@dlluncor yup yup completely understand. Yeah my guess is that some of the deployments may have been mixed up because I think some of things we expected to be Python 2 ended up having weird Python 3 errors, or maybe a Python2 deployment happened from master instead of the release branch or something like that

yes i believe the deployments got a bit mixed up during some testing — shaunak will help to resolve and get to a functioning PY2 environment — sorry for the troubles since we didn’t have a functioning PY2 environment for some number of hours!
no worries! And yeah re Fetcher, unsure if it was a webdriver issue versus a fetcher issue, but didnt seem like any custom fetchers were working on instabase.com (http://instabase.com) or dogfood
Could you share the link? Custom fetchers work in my testing — but it’s up to the Custom Fetcher owner to make their script Python 3 compatible

My intention was to ask everyone with UDFs to run their code on alt.dogfood since we had it up and running for a month — and also to give us the UDFs to help people transition it :slightly_smiling_face: — seems not enough people took us up on that offer :slightly_smiling_face:
